thread.title: Market overview: Commodity stocks lead gains ahead of FOMC
thread.title_full: Market overview: Commodity stocks lead gains ahead of FOMC

title: Market overview: Commodity stocks lead gains ahead of FOMC
text:
0.0135 -0.0013 
  1630: Commodity-related stocks saw the biggest gains on the top flight index as traders stepped aside ahead of tomorrow's US Fed decision. Glencore (Xetra: A1JAGV - news ) led the charge after raising Â£1.6bn through a share placing to replenish its battered capital position. It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) was SAB Miller's shares however that shined brightest after rival Inbev's interest in the company was confirmed. Front month Brent crude futures were firmer by 5.49% to $47.04 per barrel on the ICE. Overnight, the Shanghai Stock Exchange's Composite Index registered a 4.89% advance to end the day at 3,152.26 points. FTSE 100 up by 91.61 points to 6,229.21. 
1330: US consumer prices advanced at a 0.2% month-on-month clip in August, the same as in June and as expected by analysts. At the core level the cost of living was unchanged at 1.8% year-on-year (consensus: 1.9%). 
1330: Three-month copper futures rose 1.4% to reach $5,439.50 per metric tonne on the LME. 
1101: S&P has downgraded its rating on Japan's long-term sovereign debt to A+/A-1 from AA-/A-1+.1101: S&P has downgraded its rating on Japan's long-term sovereign debt to A+/A-1 from AA-/A-1+. 
1017: SAB Miller says it expects AB Inbev to make an offer, although no proposal has been put forth yet. 
1014: " The latest inflation, earnings and economic activity reinforces our belief that it is a very close call as to whether the Bank of England lifts interest rates from 0.50% to 0.75% around February, or holds fire until the second quarter," says Dr.Howard Archer chief UK+European economist at IHS Global Insight. 
0930: The unemployment rate edged lower to 5.5%, down from a print of 5.6% in the second quarter, according to the Office for National Statistics.Economists had been expecting it to remain steady. 
0915: Stocks have started the morning higher ahead of today's employment report. Investors are also waiting on this afternoon's appearance by Governor Carney before the Treasury Select Committee. Intriguingly, he will be flanked by three rather hawkish members, McCafferty, Forbes and Weale. Miners are doing worst in the early going despite gains overnight for Shanghai stocks. The latest US and euro area CPI (Other OTC: CPICQ - news ) numbers are also set for release this afternoon. FTSE 100 up 42.43 points 6,179.73.
